target_audience.primary: The 'Aspirant' Gen Z (16-24 years old). Uzbek university students or IELTS preppers who cannot afford private tutors ($100/mo) but own a smartphone. They are shy to speak in class due to fear of mistakes.
target_audience.secondary: The 'Digital Mom' (25-35 years old). Wants her children to learn English but lacks time to drive them to learning centers. Uses Telegram for everything from recipes to news.

strategy.uvp: InglizchaAI: The English tutor that never sleeps, never judges, and costs less than a Somsa. Practice speaking 24/7 directly in Telegram.
channels: Telegram (Primary ecosystem: Channel, Groups, Bot Store)
Instagram Reels (Discovery: Viral demos of AI speaking Uzbek)

viral_mechanics.referral_loop: Implement a 'Share for XP' system. 3 Invites = 1 Week Unlimited Voice Mode. (Leverages the 'xp_points' in your DB schema).
viral_mechanics.shareable_assets: After a conversation, the bot generates a 'Report Card' image (e.g., 'Pronunciation Score: 92%') that users can post to their Instagram Stories/Telegram Stories to flex on friends.
viral_mechanics.scarcity_launch: Position the first 1,000 users as 'Founding Members' who get a special badge/status, creating a rush to join.

content_plan.topic: The Problem: Why English tutors are expensive & scary.
Interactive: 'Can you beat the AI?' Pronunciation Challenge.
Behind the Scenes: How ChatGPT + Whisper works (Trust building).
User Spotlight: Someone improved their IELTS score.
Referral Drive: Unlock Premium for Free.
